intro: Ferula leiophylla, commonly known as the Persian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds enclosed in a bract-like structure, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Ferula. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
